description: Change of use of existing railway arches to vehicle rental premises (Sui Generis), the erection of a modular building and rental vehicle wash bay, together with associated works and car parking.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Dwg. Nos. U1XXDSH01, U1XXDSH03, U1XXDSH05, U1XXDSH07, U1XXDSH10, U1XXDSH11, 19666, BI1029_U1XX; Flood risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy (April 2022) Version B by PJA, Planning Statement/Cover Letter (2 August 2022) by Planning Prospects, Delivery and Servicing Plan (March 2022) Version A by PJA, Activity Noise Assessment (March 2022) Rev A by Syntegra, Healthy Streets Transport Statement (March 2022) Version A by PJA, Fire Safety Strategy (September 2022), Ecological survey beneath a series of rail arches, including bat Potential Roost Assessment (PRA) dated 30 November 2022 by Ecology Link]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 3 - The use hereby approved shall not be in operation (including, the delivery of
vehicles to and from, and movement of vehicles within, the site and the use of the wash-bay) and open to customers other than between the hours of 08:00 - 18:00 Monday to Friday, 09:00 - 16:00 Saturdays and 12:00 - 17:00
Sundays/Bank Holidays and at no other times.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 4 - Use of any vacuum cleaners and/or jet wash equipment associated with car
valeting shall only be undertaken within the wash-bay identified on drawing
number U1XXDSH03.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring in accordance with
DMPD Policy DMS1.
Condition : 5 - No part of the site, its forecourt or the access road shall be used to undertake maintenance and/or repairs to any vehicles. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring in accordance with
DMPD Policy DMS1.
Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved, 2no. 660 litre bins
(one for general waste and one for dry recyclables) shall be provided and
made available for use and stored within the area as identified on drawing
number U1XXDSH03 and retained thereafter. The waste and recyclables
from the development shall be managed and made available for collection in
accordance with the details set out in the application documents in perpetuity. 

Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage is provided on site and can be
readily collected to accord with the Refuse and Recyclables in Development
SPD and DMPD Policy DMS1 and DMT2.
Condition : 7 - Prior to commencement of the use hereby approved, 3no. Sheffield cycle
stands shall be provided adjacent to the modular building (as indicated on
drawing U1XXDSH03) for use by employees and visitors and retained
thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of maximising the opportunities for travel to and from
the development by sustainable modes in accordance with DMPD Policy
DMT2 and London Plan Policy T5.
Condition : 8 - The hereby approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Flood risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy (April 2022) Version B by PJA. The mitigation measures shall be fully implemented prior to occupation of any part of the development or within any other period as may be agreed in writing by the local planning authority by way of submission of details pursuant to this condition and maintained and retained in perpetuity for the lifetime of the development. 

Reason: To minimise the risk of internal flooding and to ensure the safety of
occupants during a flood, in accordance with DMPD Policy DMS5 and to
ensure accordance with the Flood and Water Management Act 2010.
Condition : 9 - Prior to commencement of the use hereby approved, a Flood Warning and
Evacuation Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local
planning authority. The Plan shall set out the specific details for a flood
evacuation plan, safe access/egress routes and responsibility for
implementing the Plan in the event of a flood event. The approved Plan shall
be implemented upon commencement of the approved use and throughout
the lifetime of the development. 

Reason: To ensure the safety of occupants during a flood, in accordance with DMPD Policy DMS5 and to ensure accordance with the Flood and Water Management Act 2010.
Condition : 10 - Prior to installation, details of any external lighting shall be submitted to and
approved in writing by the local planning authority. Such details shall include,
but not be limited to, light fixture locations, type of lighting, colour coded lux
levels. This lighting plan must follow best practice industry guidance produced by the Bat Conservation Trust and Institute of Lighting Professionals. Light levels around any biodiversity features must be less than 1 lux. The details shall be implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance, to protect neighbouring
residentsï¿½ amenity and promote biodiversity in accordance with DMPD
policies DMS1 and DMO4.
Condition : 11 - In accordance with the "Ecological survey beneath a series of rail arches,
including bat Potential Roost Assessment (PRA)" dated 30 November 2022
by Ecology Link, any works that may impact the existing girders within the
arches shall only be carried out outside the bird nesting season (February to
September).

Reason: In the interests of promoting biodiversity gain in the area, in
accordance with DMPD Policy DMO4.
Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.  
Condition : 13 - INFORMATIVE: Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL): From the information available, it appears that the development permitted is subject to a Community Infrastructure Levy charge in accordance with the Community Infrastructure Levy Regulations 2010 (as amended) (the "Regulations"). 
You or the relevant interested parties are required to provide the Council with the information set out in the Regulations. This process for the collection of CIL includes:  the requirement to complete an "Assumption of Liability" form as soon as possible;  in order to claim charitable exemption or social housing relief or other forms of relief you or the relevant interested party should also complete a "Claiming Exemption or Relief" form. 
The Council will, if appropriate, then issue a Liability Notice(s) which details the charges due. As soon as the developer, landowner or other interested party(ies) is aware of the date when development is going to start they must also submit a "Commencement Notice".  Failure to comply with the Regulations, including failure to complete the forms when required or providing inaccurate information can lead to surcharges or other penalties as set out in the Regulations. It can also mean that any exemptions or reliefs are lost.
General information on the Community Infrastructure Levy, including the forms mentioned above can be found on the Planning Portal (www.planningportal.gov.uk). Details of the Mayoral CIL can be found on the GLA and TfL websites (www.london.gov.uk and www.tfl.gov.uk). The Assumption of Liability Form, Claiming of Exemption or Relief Form and Commencement Notice must be sent to: Community Infrastructure Levy Environment and Community Services Wandsworth Council Town Hall London SW18 2PU cil@wandsworth.gov.uk Fax: 020 8871 6003 (marked FAO CIL). 
Condition : 14 - INFORMATIVE: Any assessment of CIL liability by the Council has been based on the information provided. The assessment of CIL liability referred to in this informative is indicative only and is not intended to provide a binding estimate of the actual CIL liability likely to be incurred.  The assessment of the actual CIL liability will be provided pursuant to and in accordance with the Community Infrastructure Levy Regulations 2010 (as amended).  Where the calculation of CIL liability includes taking account of the existing use of a building, CIL liability may change if the information provided in relation to the existing use(s) of buildings, is not still current at the time of the decision which first permits development.
